output.conclusion: This course has provided a comprehensive overview of basic electrical engineering principles. Further study and practical application are essential for mastery.
output.introduction: Welcome to Basic Electrical Engineering! This course is designed for individuals with a strong technical background seeking a rapid refresher or a concise overview of fundamental electrical engineering concepts.

chapters.description: Review of voltage, current, and resistance. Ohm's Law and its applications. Power and energy calculations in DC circuits. Series and parallel resistor combinations. Voltage and current dividers.

chapters.chapterTitle: Kirchhoff's Laws and Circuit Analysis Techniques
chapters.description: In-depth exploration of Kirchhoff's Current Law (KCL) and Kirchhoff's Voltage Law (KVL). Nodal and mesh analysis techniques for solving complex DC circuits. Source transformations and superposition theorem.
Application of Thevenin's and Norton's theorems for circuit simplification. Maximum power transfer theorem and its implications. Practical examples and advanced problem-solving.

chapters.chapterTitle: Capacitors and Inductors: Behavior and Characteristics
chapters.description: Detailed analysis of capacitors and inductors. Voltage-current relationships. Energy storage. Series and parallel combinations. Transient response in RC and RL circuits.

chapters.chapterTitle: AC Fundamentals: Sinusoidal Waveforms and Phasors
chapters.description: Introduction to alternating current (AC). Sinusoidal waveforms: amplitude, frequency, phase. Phasor representation of AC quantities. Impedance and admittance.

chapters.chapterTitle: AC Circuit Analysis: Impedance, Power, and Resonance
chapters.description: AC circuit analysis using impedance. Power calculations in AC circuits: real, reactive, and apparent power. Power factor correction. Series and parallel resonance.
Overview of semiconductor materials. Introduction to diodes: characteristics and applications. Bipolar junction transistors (BJTs) and field-effect transistors (FETs): operation and biasing.

chapters.chapterTitle: Operational Amplifiers: Ideal Characteristics and Applications
chapters.description: Ideal operational amplifier (op-amp) characteristics. Inverting and non-inverting amplifier configurations. Summing amplifiers, difference amplifiers, and integrators.

chapters.chapterTitle: Digital Logic Gates: Basic Gates and Boolean Algebra
chapters.description: Introduction to digital logic gates: AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR. Boolean algebra and logic simplification. Combinational logic circuits.
